description: Blazing fast in-memory data storage with Redis.

slides.title: What is Key-Value? üîë
slides.content:
# Simple & Fast ‚ö°

The simplest NoSQL model.

Every item has a **Key** and a **Value**.

Like a giant Python Dictionary or Hash Map.

**Redis** is the most popular example (keeps data in RAM).

slides.title: Basic Commands
slides.content:
# SET & GET üèì

`SET user:100 "Alice"`

`GET user:100` -> "Alice"

`DEL user:100`

Atomic operations ensure safety even with concurrency.

slides.title: Data Structures
slides.content:
# More than Strings üßµ

Redis supports rich data types:

- **Lists:** Ordered queues.
- **Sets:** Unique collections.
- **Hashes:** Maps (Fields/Values).
- **Sorted Sets:** Sets with scores.

slides.title: Hashes
slides.content:
# Objects üóÉÔ∏è

Store an object under a single key.

`HSET user:100 name "Alice" age 30`

`HGETALL user:100`

`HGET user:100 age`

slides.title: Lists
slides.content:
# Queues üö∂

Add to head or tail.

`LPUSH tasks "email"`
`RPUSH tasks "cleanup"`

`LPOP tasks` (Process first item).

Great for implementation message queues / job queues.

slides.title: Command Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which Redis command retrieves the value associated with a specific key?

slides.title: Sets
slides.content:
# Uniqueness ‚ùÑÔ∏è

Unordered collection of unique strings.

`SADD visitors "192.168.1.1"`
`SADD visitors "192.168.1.1"` (Ignored duplicate)

`SMEMBERS visitors`

slides.title: Expiration
slides.content:
# Time to Live ‚è≥

Automatically delete keys after a set time.

`SET session:123 "data" EX 60` (Expires in 60s).

Great for caching and temporary sessions.

slides.title: Pub/Sub
slides.content:
# Real-time üì°

Publish/Subscribe messaging pattern.

- Client A: `SUBSCRIBE news`
- Client B: `PUBLISH news "Hello World!"`

Client A instantly receives the message.

slides.title: Sorted Sets
slides.content:
# Leaderboards üèÜ

Every member has a score.

`ZADD ranking 100 "Alice"`
`ZADD ranking 200 "Bob"`

`ZRANGE ranking 0 -1` (Returns ordered list).

slides.title: Persistence
slides.content:
# RDB & AOF üíæ

Even though it's in-memory, Redis can save to disk.

- **RDB:** Snapshots at intervals.
- **AOF (Append Only File):** Logs every write operation.

slides.title: Feature Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the best use case for the 'Expiration' feature in Redis?
quizOptions: Caching API responses for a short duration

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Key-Value üîë

Speed is King.

- **RAM:** In-memory speed.
- **Structures:** List, Set, Hash.
- **TTL:** Auto-expiry.
- **Pub/Sub:** Messaging.
